formal_accuser.name: Nicolas Melletz
formal_accuser.relationship_to_accused: villager/community member - feared harm from accused

confession.seduction_context: Had quarrel with one named le Baleux, who called her witch; was crying as she went to woods towards dusk, and approached by man in black who asked her to renounce God - beat her when she refused. Came to garden next day, and beat her again on further refusal, after which she yielded.
powder_types: mixture of black and green powder
made with body of stillborn child
sabbat_locations: place where there were 12 or 13 people
sabbat_activities: eating meat without bread or salt

testimony.quarrel_subject: Bought manure from outside her house, and she wanted him to take it away immediately so they could do some building; he could not do this
Asked him to plough for her, but he refused, saying his harness was in poor condition; Also dispute over oven ownership in their kitchen

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: 3 days after she came and asked after it
after being pressed to sell oven

testimony.quarrel_subject: Took his animals to drink at well near her house, and she had several times been angry
Called her witch saying he would have her burned

witnesses.name: Nicolle
witnesses.occupation: wife of Demenge Colas le maire

testimony.quarrel_subject: Had her husband fined for damage to garden
testimony.threat_quote: she said she never wished to see him again

witnesses.name: Marguerite
witnesses.occupation: wife of Hans le petit Benet

testimony.quarrel_subject: When she came to veillée in his house he said 'allé je suis bien sot de vous rechauffer quand vous m'as couté mon bien'
Fist fight with her brother, called him 'fils de sorcier'
testimony.threat_quote: she appeared and told him he would repent

testimony.quarrel_subject: He had bought some reeds, and refused to sell her any of them; also had argument when he was unloading grain
testimony.threat_quote: tu cause bien maintenant mais tu ne causeras pas tousjours

witnesses.name: Cretienne femme de Couret le petit Feltin

testimony.quarrel_subject: Dispute with witness and mother-in-law about some sowing

harms_alleged.harm_description: bad leg, from which she still suffered

testimony.quarrel_subject: Made her a piece of cloth and asked for payment
Took hay from a field previously cropped by her husband
When he was banyard found her daughter with other children who had 3 hats full of pears; threatened to fine them; her husband came and threatened him

harms_alleged.harm_description: trouble with eyes, going blind in a week

timeline.subject: Jeanne le Schrempt
timeline.details: Nicolas Melletz marchal d'Assenoncourt asks for her arrest and taking of depositions; substitut du PG at Dieuze also asks for arrest

timeline.subject: Jeanne le Schrempt
timeline.details: Substitut orders that she be arrested, questioned, and confronted

timeline.subject: Jeanne le Schrempt
timeline.details: Confronted with witnesses; offered natural explanations for some harms

timeline.subject: Jeanne le Schrempt
timeline.details: C.M. Rémy asks for question ordinaire et extraordinaire

timeline.subject: Jeanne le Schrempt
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture; confessed after being presented to strappado

timeline.subject: Jeanne le Schrempt
timeline.details: Rémy asks for death sentence, and Change agrees

timeline.subject: Jeanne le Schrempt
timeline.details: Executed; at execution declared 'ne scavoir aucun mal sur ceulx qu'elle avoit accusé' (knew nothing evil about those she had accused)

accomplices_named.name: Jeannon femme Meillard
accomplices_named.context: Named in confession as accomplice in making powder to kill calves; met her outside house and signaled to follow

accomplices_named.name: Imeline veuve Colas Cherier
accomplices_named.context: Named in confession as accomplice in making powder to kill calves

accomplices_named.name: Gerardin Marchal
accomplices_named.context: Named as present when they made powder with body of stillborn child

prior_accusations.context: Mother executed as witch about 20 years before (circa 1593); accused described as 'de race infecte'
A sister already executed as witch

notable_quotes.speaker: Jeanne le Schrempt
notable_quotes.french: elle savoit bien qu'il y en avoit, en disant fict fict au diable il ne les fault pas çeler j'en ay trop veu, pourquoy les laisse on tant vivre, elles ne font poinct de bien, il y a vingt ans sy l'on les eust toutes bruslé elles n'eust poinct tant faict de mal qu'elles ont faict
notable_quotes.english: she knew well that there were [witches], saying damn the devil they must not hide them I've seen too much, why do they let them live so long, they do no good, if 20 years ago they had burned them all they would not have done so much harm as they have done
notable_quotes.context: On way to market at Dieuze, speaking of witches with other women (witness 12)

notable_quotes.speaker: Jeanne le Schrempt to Cretaille Estienne
notable_quotes.french: tu cause bien maintenant mais tu ne causeras pas tousjours
notable_quotes.english: you speak well now but you won't always speak
notable_quotes.context: Threat during argument when he refused to sell her reeds (witness 11)

notable_quotes.speaker: Michiel Beze Michel to Jeanne
notable_quotes.french: allé je suis bien sot de vous rechauffer quand vous m'as couté mon bien
notable_quotes.english: go, I am very foolish to warm you when you have cost me my goods
notable_quotes.context: At veillée 3 years before she came to his house (witness 9)

notable_quotes.speaker: Jeanne le Schrempt
notable_quotes.french: quand l'on en a prien une l'on laisse les autres sy l'on en eut prien il y at une vaintaine dans
notable_quotes.english: when they arrest one they leave the others, if they arrested them there are about twenty in [the village]

notable_quotes.speaker: Jeanne le Schrempt
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle ne craindoit d'estre damnée de dire cela sy elle ne l'estoit aucunement, car elle an avoit trop veu
notable_quotes.english: that she was not afraid of being damned for saying this if she was not [damned] in any way, because she had seen too much
notable_quotes.context: Insisting on her statements about witches in the village (witness 18)

notable_quotes.speaker: Jeanne le Schrempt
notable_quotes.french: au nom du pere et du filz et du St Esprit et de Madame Saincte Odille, et que Dieu luy veille renvoyer sa vue
notable_quotes.english: in the name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit and of Madame Saint Odille, and may God send back his sight
notable_quotes.context: Prayer said when curing Claudin Boulengier's blindness with root (witness 17)

notable_quotes.speaker: Jeanne le Schrempt
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle n'en scauroit que faire, et que l'on luy fait grand tort
notable_quotes.english: that she didn't know what to do about it, and that they do her great wrong
notable_quotes.context: Response when asked about her reputation during interrogation

notable_quotes.speaker: Jeanne le Schrempt at execution
notable_quotes.french: ne scavoir aucun mal sur ceulx qu'elle avoit accusé
notable_quotes.english: knew nothing evil about those she had accused
notable_quotes.context: Final statement at execution, retracting accusations of accomplices

relationships.evidence_text: daughter of Michel Schrempt and his wife Guele
Cretienne femme de Couret le petit Feltin
As neighbour had often heard her swear by the devil
had fist fight with her brother

economic_context.details: Dispute over oven ownership in Michiel Laboureur's kitchen; witness 2 was pressed to sell oven to accused's husband for 4 francs after losing calves. Payment dispute with Simon Lampert over piece of cloth. Accused described herself and husband as 'pauvres manouvriers' (poor day laborers). Mayor Demenge Colas lost horses worth 1600 francs.

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Bought manure from outside her house, could not remove it immediately as she wanted
Refused to plough for her, saying harness in poor condition
Wife did not reply when accused asked after the horse
Pressed to sell oven in their kitchen
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: after losing calves, sold oven for 4 francs

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Took animals to drink at well near her house, she was angry
Called her witch, said he would have her burned
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: over last 5 years; one soon after quarrel

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Had her husband fined for damage to garden
Said to her at veillée 'I am foolish to warm you when you have cost me my goods'

harms_catalog.harm_description: best horse fell and broke its neck
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Fist fight with her brother, called him 'fils de sorcier'
Refused to sell her reeds; argument when unloading grain

harms_catalog.harm_description: bad leg, still suffering from it

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Took hay from field previously cropped by her husband

harms_catalog.harm_description: trouble with eyes, going blind in a week
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Threatened to fine her daughter for stealing pears; husband came and threatened him

material_culture.context: Crisman Lampert bought manure from outside accused's house
Michiel Laboureur's harness was in poor condition, used as excuse not to plough
Oven in kitchen of Michiel Laboureur which originally belonged to accused; sold for 4 francs
Well near accused's house where George Villermin took animals to drink
Cretaille Estienne bought reeds and refused to sell any to accused
Cretaille Estienne was unloading grain when argument occurred
Hen taken as offering to pilgrimage at Vic
Basket taken as offering to pilgrimage at Vic

material_culture.object: root for eyes (racine pour les yeulx)
material_culture.context: Herbal remedy used by accused to cure blindness; father had used same method
Simon Lampert made her a piece of cloth
Blaisse Pierre took hay from field previously cropped by accused's husband
Accused's daughter had 3 hats full of pears
Mistress Schneider had lot of candlewax in room
Used to fly to sabbat in confession
Took out from under stone to make powder in confession
Made from stillborn child's body, used for maleficia in confession
Kept and took when wanted to do harm in confession
Unable to swallow at Easter, hid under scarf and threw away
Used to hide host
Devil offered her money but struck her on ear when she refused
Wine served in glasses at sabbat
Rich witches drank from silver cups at sabbat according to accused's story
Poor witches drank from glasses at sabbat
Witch from Guermange came across pond of Lindre in coach

spatial_references.context: Primary location of trial; residence of accused and most witnesses
Location of substitut du PG; market destination for women; accused escorted there
Where accused went crying and was approached by devil; where Cretienne returned from with accused
Pilgrimage destination where accused took hen and basket as offerings
Where Claudin Genin went to doctor who could not cure his blindness
Village mentioned in accused's story about witches at sabbat
Witch allegedly came across it in coach to sabbat
Where accused and accomplices tried to make hail to waste vines
Sabbat meeting location at midnight in confession
Where accused confessed to poisoning horse
Where devil took them to poison calves in confession
Where devil came second day to beat accused; damage to garden caused fine
Where root for eyes was found; hayfield dispute; field ploughing

economic_hardship_indicators: accused described self and husband as 'pauvres manouvriers'
harvest season hardship mentioned by Nicolas Melletz

prior_legal_disputes.description: Austien le Maire had accused's husband fined for damage to garden

legal_context.redress_outcome: Accused said she and husband called witness witch without any action following, though accused said they did her great wrong and it was a great sin
legal_context.imprisonment_conditions: Nicolas Melletz asked that he not be imprisoned since this would cause hardship in harvest season

hearsay_chains.content: Suspected some evil persons of causing him to go blind
Heard she had given Claudin a root but did not know if it cured him
Story about witches of Guermange at sabbat - accused said she knew it by hearsay
Warned him he might suffer misfortune for taking hay from field

emotional_state_notes: crying as she went to woods after being called witch
spat on ground saying nothing when called to renounce Devil
promised to tell truth if given time when presented with strappado
started denying again when brought back, but confessed when presented to torture

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Offered natural explanations for deaths of Michiel Laboureur's calves - one had been 'mordu d'une mousatte', the other struck by a bull
Said she treated Claudin Boulengier before he went to doctor, not after

third_parties.name: le Baleux (also called Demenge Collas)
third_parties.relationship_to_accused: person who quarreled with her and called her witch
third_parties.context: Seduction story begins with quarrel with this person; later identified as Demenge Collas whose horse was allegedly poisoned

third_parties.name: Demenge Ballou
third_parties.context: Once called her 'noir gipsine, noir diable ou noir sorciere' but no witnesses

third_parties.name: wife of Demenge Ballou
third_parties.context: Said she wished accused were burned like 'la Gaidste'

third_parties.name: la Gaidste
third_parties.context: Previously executed witch mentioned as comparison

third_parties.name: Schneider
third_parties.context: Accused was in service of Schneider 23 years earlier around time of mother's execution

third_parties.name: wife of Schneider
third_parties.context: In habit of taking light into room where she had lot of candlewax; accused suspected witchcraft

third_parties.name: brother of accused
third_parties.context: Had fist fight with Didier Chatron who called him 'fils de sorcier'

third_parties.name: daughter of accused
third_parties.context: Found with other children who had 3 hats full of pears

third_parties.name: sister-in-law of Cretienne
third_parties.context: Suspicions about accused were passed to her, then to accused

third_parties.name: father of accused
third_parties.context: Died of plague; had used same root remedy for eyes

third_parties.name: mother of accused
third_parties.context: Executed as witch about 20 years before (circa 1593)

third_parties.name: le vieux marchal
third_parties.context: Accused allegedly said if they arrested him he might tell about hail damage at Assenoncourt

extraction_metadata.notes: Very detailed trial record with extensive witness testimony (18 witnesses), clear timeline, confession under torture, and execution. Notable for accused's ambiguous statements about witches that were used against her, family history of execution (mother and sister), healing activities, and final retraction at execution. Confession obtained under threat of strappado; accused confessed when presented to torture but retracted accusations of accomplices at execution. Rich detail on economic disputes, material culture, and social relationships. Updated 2025-12-25 to backfill new schema fields: language_region, formal_accuser, economic_status, practiced_healing, healing_types, person_id fields, and expanded change_de_nancy object.
